column4: i need help with my Firefox. It seems that when i go onto myspace and look at profiles that have certain themes i cannot click on Send Message,  Add Friend, Instant Message, Picutes. But I know it is on Ubuntu because when i go onto Windows OS i am able to click on them. Please help
chances are it's just a difference between the way firefox and IE render web pages
Hmm... can you give me an example of one?
I've requested to add you as a friend so I can see your profile
I see what the problem is. There's a bug in the Flash plugin for Firefox which causes flash applets to appear over top of everything else, even if they are supposed to display underneath things
You can use Adblock to disable individual flash objects to work around the problem
one sec
I've looked again at that page, and I'm not sure Adblock will fix the problem after all. The thing is, if you hide the flash applet you won't be able to see the links to click on them
once you've installed adblock, you'll see a tab on each Flash applet on a webpage you visit that says "Block", click on that.
but like I say, on those Myspace pages, when you block the applet, you won't be able to see the links to click on them
by default it should only be blocking ads
what is it blocking that you need to click on?

adblock isn't blocking the links. If you've told it to block the flash applet, you just can't see the links. See, what's happening is the theme makes the links invisible and puts them over the text in the flash applet, to make it look like you're clicking on the flash applet
you will probably have to wait until the bug in Flash is fixed
or install a userscript to block custom myspace themes, like this one: http://userscripts.org/scripts/show/997
first install Greasemonkey: https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/748
then click on the "Install Script" link at http://userscripts.org/scripts/show/997
it should be, just testing it myself here
you can, but only if you like seeing ads on web pages :)
looks like I spoke too soon. You'll still need to use Adblock to disable the flash applets
sorry man, that's about all I can suggest...
you can remove the add-ons from the Tools>Add-Ons menu
what instructions did you follow to install IE?
http://www.tatanka.com.br/ies4linux/page/Uninstall
